div.p: The goal of the TEI Special Interest Group on Manuscripts is to bring together users of the TEI who wish to improve the encoding strategies for marking up transcriptions and editions of manuscript materials.

list.head: This SIG explores a range of issues common to editing manuscripts, including:
list.item: how to record the physical appearance of a manuscript or printed witness
how to record different writing acts
how to record different kinds of variation within or across witnesses
how to use the critical apparatus tag set in manuscript transcription

div.p: The group operates by means a mailing list and also has an area on the TEI wiki.

div.head: Current Activities
div.p: The SIG is collecting issues regarding chapter 11 of the TEI Guidelines on GitHub.

div.head: Recent and Past Activities
div.p: The Manuscripts SIG has held meetings on all recent TEI Conference and Members' Meetings.
Notable earlier outputs of the SIG:

list.item: A Workgroup on Genetic Editions with this SIG developed An Encoding Model for Genetic Editions. The proposal was mostly integrated in version 2.0 of chapter 11 of the TEI Guidelines (see the release notes).
A Critical Apparatus Workgroup wrote a report on problems of the Critical Apparatus chapter and module of the TEI Guidelines.
